Interview Faye Worthy For VP for DelaineyStevens Original Message From Stevens Andria Sent Thursday June PM To McConnell Mike Hannon Kevin Lavorato John Pina Rafael Cc Pieper Kalen Chapman Kay Phillips Cathy BROWN CAROL Hillis Kimberly Subject Tuesday June Interview with Faye Worthy I have attached the interview scheduleevaluation form and resume for the exploratory interview on Tuesday June with Faye Worthy Please let me know if any conflicts arise in scheduling as the candidate is traveling from Columbus Ohio on Monday June A hard copy of Fayes resume will be delivered to your offices on Friday June Thank you Andria Stevens EES Executive Referrals

Interview Manuel GallegoGreg had me refer Manuel Gallego to you Manuel is wour Philippine office and is interested in career options within trading marketing Liz Forwarded by Liz M TaylorHOUECT on PM Manuel NRONDEVELOPMENT PM To Greg CT cc Ann nronXGate Christopher B nronXGate Liz M CT Subject Request for Meeting Dear Greg I just spoke with Liz regarding my request for a brief meeting with you this week In light of Enrons overall thrust to focus on merchant oriented activities and to diminish exposure on assets in emerging market my boss Chris Hunt suggested that I meet with you among other individuals to seek advice on alternative career options at Enron Although I am open to areas in which I would be most useful to the company I do have a particular interest in getting involved in wholesale electricity markets I hope you will have the time to meet briefly For your convenience attached below is my resume Best regards Manuel Embedded Picture Metafile

Interview Mark Kierlanczyk Vinces ManPlease make arrangements for the interview with this candidate for a trading position Interviews with John Lavorato Jeff Shankman Gary Hickerson Stinson Gibner I talked to him in New York and he is considering other opportunities so we have to act fast I think John will like him more than Punit Thanks From Sasha Divelbiss Attached you will find the interview packet for the abovereferenced person The interview will happen Monday March Please print all three documents for your hard copies If you have any questions or conflicts of schedule please do not hesitate to contact me Sasha Divelbiss

Interview Robert Downer Robert will call herecan you set up a phone interview with this guy next week Original Message From Leanne Meier ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESLeanneMeierCleanneEmeiersympaticoEcaE NRONcom Sent Thursday March PM To Subject Employment Query Robert Downer by way of Brian Edgeworth Mr Lavorato I was given your name by Brian Edgeworth as a possible contact for employment opportunities with Enron I was part of Goldman Sachs C fixed income effort for four years Goldman recently decided to exit this business entirely I was involved in a tradingcapital markets role in both C corporate bonds and securitized products I am interested in Enron because I believe it to be one of the smarter organizations out there I am flexible in terms of location I have attached a copy of my resume for your perusal I thank you in advance for your time and consideration I can be reached either via the phone number below or by replying to this email I will attempt to contact you in the next couple of days to confirm your receipt of this email Regards Robert Downer Robert Downer Resumedoc

Mtg Chinese Wall Classroom Trainingme up Original Message From Frevert Mark Sent Friday February PM To Bibi Philippe A Bowen Jr Raymond Gomez Julie Kean Steven Kitchen Louise Lavorato John McConnell Mike McMahon Jeffrey Miller Michael Piper Greg Shankman Jeffrey Shapiro Richard Sherriff John Whalley Greg Subject Chinese Wall Classroom Training Chinese Wall training of one hour has been scheduled on the dates listed below The training is mandatory and allows EWS to continue operating all its businesses including equity trading without violating the securities laws Please register for one of the four onehour sessions listed below Each session is tailored to a particular commercial group and it would be preferable if you could attend the session for your group Your particular group is the one highlighted in bold on the list below Monday March am Resource Group Monday March am OriginationBusiness Development Monday March pm Financial Trading Group Monday March pm Heads of Trading Desks Each of the above sessions will be held at the downtown Hyatt Regency Hotel in Sandalwood Rooms A B Alterntatively two makeup sessions are scheduled for Tuesday March at pm and pm Location information for the makeup sessions will be announced later Please confirm your attendance at one of these sessions with Brenda Whitehead by emailing her at or calling her at extension Mark Frevert and Mark Haedicke

All Employee Meeting Ken LayJeff Skillingjoin us at an AllEmployee Meeting at am Houston time Wednesday Feb The meeting will be held in Houstons Hyatt Regency Imperial Ballroom We will review Enrons yearend financial and operating results and discuss our outlook for the future The meeting will be streamed live on IPTV to employees in Houston Omaha Portland ENA New York Calgary London Stockholm Frankfurt Amsterdam Madrid Toronto Dublin Ohio and San Ramon and Costa Mesa in Calif In addition we will broadcast the meeting via video teleconference to employees in Portland EBS Chicago Tehachapi Calif Sao Paulo Rio de Janeiro Buenos Aires and San Juan Detailed instructions for viewing the meeting on the IPTV web site will follow Employees based in Europe Japan and Australia You will receive an additional communication about the meeting with more details on how to access the meeting andor receive a videotape of the meeting if you are located in a remote office with limited access to IPTV All other employees If you dont have access to IPTV or if you do are unable to attend or view the meeting you can order a video by contacting Courtney Votaw by email or phone As always we welcome your questions Submit them to Erin Rice by email fax or interoffice mail EBC The deadline for advance questions is Thursday Feb Mark your calendar See you there

Mtg Kevin KuykendallMichael L MillerJennifer Adams ServeronWed like to meet at pm today to seek approval for our latest proposed investment Were looking to put up to million out of a million total round into Serveron which designs and partially assembles both transformer monitoring equipment and battery monitoring equipment Their business model is twofold They both sell the equipment outright for those companies that want to perform the monitoring services themselves and they offer a monthly hour remote monitoring service for those companies that would rather outsource the activity Revenues for were about K should be million plus around million The monthly burn rate over the next twelve months will scale to about K after the hiring of all of the senior management team The company will have to raise an additional round of million or so within months That amount will then take them to a cash flow positive position in Wayne Mays of ENA and Mike Boutcher of EES have both reviewed the technology and agree that Serveron has a reasonable advantage with their transformer monitoring equipment and a sizable advantage with their battery monitoring equipment Thanks Kevin x

Original Message From Guerriero Michael Sent Monday May AM To Hillis Kimberly Subject Modesto Maranzana Terminal Value Could I get on Johns schedule today or tomorrow for minutes The issue is regarding Modesto Maranzana final valuation MFG Forwarded by Michael GuerrieroSAEnron on AM Michael Guerriero AM To John J nronXGate cc Vladimir nronXGate Joe nron Subject Modesto Maranzana Terminal Value We are concluding the valuation and booking of the Modesto Maranzana transaction The final point that needs to be agreed upon to properly book the transaction is the year terminal value of the plant The model currently represents a terminal value of million based upon subjective rational We have analysed the market and economic situation thoroughly and believe it is appropriate to accurately represent the terminal value as million The rational and economic analysis is covered in the below e mail I would like to discuss this with you sometime today I will call to see if we can set up a short discussion Let me know if you would like Vlady to participate Based upon getting your concurence and the final review of the model with Joe we should be ready to book the transaction early next week MFG Forwarded by Michael GuerrieroSAEnron on AM Michael Guerriero PM To Vladimir nronXGate cc Maria Ines nron Mario Aguilar nron Subject Modesto Maranzana Terminal Value We need to review the terminal value issue in the year model As we have discussed and John I believe agreed we do not believe salvage value is relevant in this short term time frame I would also argue an arbitrary number such as million is also not reflective of the true value in year five We have already received a verbal indication from Duke that they would have an interest in the facility at million Based upon Dukes minimal due diligence this is relevant in reconfirming our initial valuation and reflecting that there is demand for power generation assets in Argentina In addition we believe the most accurate reflection of terminal value in year is closer to our initial purchase price of million The below valuations local market grid assessment and our forward power curve support this conclusion Market Multiple of EBITDA Valuation There are two public companies that are currently trading on the local stock exchange the Merval Central Puerto and Central Costanera Both are thermal power units in Argentina On average the EBITDA multiple for these companies is equal to four Modesto Maranzana assumes an EBITDA of approximately million MMPP EBITDA MM x MM This is again supportive of our valuation of million Most Recent Market Transaction Valuation On Average the last power acquisition transactions in the market were above kW and the current market average is kW Based upon MMPPs installed capacity of Mw and using the market average of kW the plant could be valued as high as million This is again supports a conservative valuation of million or per kW Embedded
